Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerComputer
      • Server
  • public class Server
extends PlayerComputer
    The server of the game. Its main purpose is to process incoming updates and send updates on the game state to the client player.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class PlayerComputer

        gameWindow, isPlaying, name, players, PORT, WIN_POINTS

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Server()
      No-args constructor for server.
      Server​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Constructs a server that begins accepting players.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void dealCard()
      Simulates a new random card being dealt by the host.
      void drawCard​(Card card)
      Simulates a new random card being dealt.
      void slapCard()
      Simulates the current player slapping a card.
      void slapCard​(java.lang.String player)
      Handles any player slapping a card.
      void startGame()
      Starts the game by notifying all connected users and creating a GameThread for the host player.
      void stopGame()
      Stops the game by stopping each user's thread.
      void updatePoints​(java.lang.String player, int diff)
      Sends a message to the client that a player's score has changed.

      • dealCard

        public void dealCard()
        Simulates a new random card being dealt by the host. Randomly generates a new card.
        Specified by:
        dealCard in class PlayerComputer

      • drawCard

        public void drawCard​(Card card)
        Simulates a new random card being dealt. Sends a message to the client that there is a new card.
        Overrides:
        drawCard in class PlayerComputer
        Parameters:
        player - the player who dealt the card.
        card - the card being dealt.
